Article/0-0-0-18/server-side-rendering.title: Server-Side Rendering
Article/0-0-0-18/server-side-rendering.html:
Nullstack optimizes SEO and response times out of the box by generating HTML for the route<\/a> that you enter the application from.<\/p>

Server-side rendering is good for SEO since it gives as fast as possible crawlable markup for search engines.<\/p>

Nullstack starts the application for the user by first serving HTML of only the requested page with no overhead.<\/p>

Before serving the HTML, Nullstack will wait for prepare<\/code><\/a> and initiate<\/code><\/a> of all components of that route to be resolved.<\/p>

While server-side rendering all server functions run locally without the need to fetch an API, making the process even faster.<\/p>

After the document is already painted in the browser, Nullstack loads the JavaScript client bundle and starts the hydration<\/a> process.<\/p>

No further requests to the server are made to recover the application state during hydration<\/a>.<\/p>

The page head will generate the necessary meta tags for SEO based on the contents of the project<\/code><\/a> and page<\/code><\/a> context keys.<\/p>

This is the default build mode and also the mode used for development.<\/p>

It is a good pratice to follow SSR patterns in development in order to be able to easily change betweeb build modes in production.<\/p>
